reviews.text: We went to Bristol Restaurant after a show at the Music Hall. At the hour we got there (4 PM) we had the restaurant to ourselves. Great service with an outstanding happy hour. Service, menu selections, food preparation and price were all outstanding. We have been there many times before and are always pleased. Will certainly go back.

It was cold and snowing but it didn't matter. The atmosphere here was absolutely exciting. We checked out most of what they had to offer. Enjoyed ourselves greatly. Looking forward to returning in near future. Also we stayed fairly close to there. So we called and had Uber take us back and forth. It was a lot cheaper then expected. Great night.

Being from STL, it almost seems impossible for a downtown area in a major city to be clean, safe and packed chock-full of businesses in every large space and every nook and cranny. There is never any shortage of things to do in KC. If you want to bring your significant other for a weekend of eating and drinking until you can barely stand it, a weekend with the boys or girls and total shenanigans, or a super fun weekend with the kids...KC is a great place to consider. Great food, unbeatable atmosphere and plenty of well lit centrally located parking.  That's unheard of! Great people watching, tons of arts & music...KC makes me jealous that we can't have nice things at home.

Not all parties and bars and loud. Great little village almost in down down. During the day. We lived here in the financial district for 8 years. And this was one of the best days we had being tourist.

This is a wonderful, youthful, spirited part of Kansas City. Just like each and every other district has its own "attitude", P&L is no different. Lots of shops and places to eat, the night scene is like a mall of clubs/bars, and the Sprint Center is right smack in there too! Plus you have lots of luxury apartments filling up the space. If you like the hustle bustle kind of city, this is where you find it most in KC.

Fun place for everyone who likes basketball to go and play some basketball related games. There are different challenges throughout. You can also read  and see some history too. About an hour and a half is good amount of time to experience it all. Beware there will be some wild kids running around unsupervised.
I love this amazing place. Another reason why Midwest Folks are the most friendliest people ever. Can’t wait to come back for another visit again soon!

The CBE is the official hall of fame for men's college basketball so it's really cool that it is in Kansas City. It is a large attraction and you will spend many hours inside. There's a museum component and a dynamic interactive component, so whether you enjoy playing around or learning about the history of the game you will have a great time.
This place is so cool but kind of expensive. I feel for families that have several kids and have to pay $12 per kid. Otherwise, it is worth the trip you definitely have to go at least once.

Brought the kids here on a rainy day when we had a day off school. It was not busy. We had some fun shooting hoops and it was a decent diversion. This place well earns its ONE-STAR rating however... it calls itself the "College" Basketball Experience... yet there is not a SINGLE photo of a female college basketball player or coach in the place. Not even the UCONN team! Disgusting. I honestly cannot recommend that ANYONE ever give this place money. This place should be an actual Title IX violation. DO NOT VISIT.

Good museum with very friendly people. Nice displays presented with a good flow to tell the story of Negro league baseball. The film is a bit dated but still great and a must-see. Not quite as many artifacts as I was hoping to see, but the replica lockers are fun nonetheless. Gift shop prices were reasonable for high-quality merchandise. Most notably, the people at the admission desk and gift shop were friendly and very helpful (they even offered to call a cab for me!).

My visit was such a great experience.  Satchel Paige was a legend even when i was a kid, so to see so much information about him in his town was a stroke of fortune.  All the greats are here, and the staff was so nice.  I’d recommend having a couple hours set aside to attend.  Admission was very affordable.

I visited the American Jazz Museum and Negro Leagues Baseball Museum as a chaperone with third graders. We had a few hosts that guided us.  Each host was a wealth of knowledge but our first hostess was the most entertaining, engaging and commanded all the kids attention.   The museums have lots of interesting historical facts and our tour was very well put together.

So much historical content that I didn't know before. Several recordings to watch among the placards and memorabilia. Lots to look at. A few items signed by Jackie Robinson! You can combine tickets with the Jazz Museum for a great deal.

I visited the American Jazz Museum and Negro Leagues Baseball Museum as a chaperone with third graders.Very clean and beautiful. Loved the staff. The bomb squad got to work with umpires. Very sweet set up.

I went to this museum a few years back and forgot to review, but it really is tremendous and moving. Does a great job with not only covering the timeline of events and number of dead, but also dives deep into why WWI happened. Take the time to visit, honor the fallen, and have a tough conversation with yourself about nationalism. 

The museum is located in this lovely park like setting. Seemed very family friendly and safe. Great community atmosphere!

What a great experience! Forgot so much about the "Great War" & the causes of it. The information is provided in a variety of mediums & from many different angles. The artifacts are amazing & diverse. I particularly enjoyed the models & descriptions of the different styles of trench warfare. My wife enjoyed the private studios to listen to music of the time. The multimedia presentations provided information & clarification to the experience. The staff was friendly and informative & always willing to help. The exterior architecture was beautiful yet humbling & added to the somewhat somber experience. Get the tickets to the tower, it's worth it. The old elevator is awesome & the view is spectacular. There are e lot of stairs, just a heads up. If you're going to the WWI museum, you'll be right next to Union Station & The Crown Center. Check those out as well.

My friend and I had no idea how much would be in the museum! It's worth it to buy the tower add-on for $5, as the view is excellent on a clear day. There is a lot of information which is well presented and the various artifacts are laid out well. A museum you should certainly visit. There is an excellent gift shop and a small cafe which serves several dishes. (Portions are small so order accordingly.)

This is definitely worth the trip no matter where you are coming from!  Tons of historical data, exhibits and artifacts of The Great War.  We spent pretty much the complete day while taking a fairly thorough view of everything.  There are several films that are both informative as well as awe-inspiring.  The staff are super helpful and obviously well versed on the events of the war.  The exhibits are not only focused on American involvement, but the causes and effects from all participants of the war.  A visit to the tower is for sure the best view in all of KC!  It won't disappoint.  Views are incredible!

KC is truly lucky to have this memorial-museum...and I am fortunate to have visited it.  Again, make the trip if you're the least bit interested in WWI and our country's history!

The museum itself is wonderful, it's an incredible display of history. My family really enjoyed the visit. It's worth the time spent to go through it. I was impressed by the staff, very knowledgeable and eager to help you learn more and enjoy your experience there! I highly recommend it

Nice place to check out if you really like "sea life". Second time we've been there, and both times were fun. It is not a very long walk through, so take your time and check out everything in there. The people working in there are very good at what they do. Very knowledgeable staff.

Great family experience. My boys who are 7 and 8 really enjoyed it. There is quite a few different stations in the sea life aquarium. There is an area where you can color on tablets as well as an area to play. Very informative and there was also a station where you could touch and feel starfish.

As this is our only aquarium I really would never give anything less than 5 stars! However, it's totally deserving of them. 

Shout out to the awesome worker that recognized Present Mic on my itabag, by the way - I smiled all day after that :)
So fun and worth the trip! My 11 month old enjoy it just as much if not more than my 3 year old. Enjoyable and a great way to teach your kids while they are having fun.

An awesome little aquarium. Located in the crown center shopping area and joined with Legoland, this aquarium is loads of family fun. The aquarium has mostly saltwater fishes, with a couple of tanks of freshwater fishes towards the beginning of the experience. That said, this aquarium does a wonderful job of having family friendly interactions. I go several times a year and always have a blast for at least 2 hours a trip, though the busier days make you feel like you should go through faster. That said, take your time and enjoy all the fish!!!

Great place to spend sometime at! There are many shops to go into and everything is accessible by walking. Street parking seems to fill up quickly but there are several parking garages that are free. Definitely a good place for out of town visitors.

The Country Club Plaza is a perfect place to go and spend the day at. The stores inside of the Plaza are also very nice and there are a lot of different shops to see. The parking there is pretty easily accessible and the walking distance around the Plaza is pretty easy going. You can spend a good part of the day here or just jump in to one of your favorite stores real quick. Security is active as well here and the pathways are pretty clean and you will see the occasional person asking for money on the sides.

You are in Kansas City, MO and are looking for a great place to hangout, have a fun evening, eat, shop, see movies and experience the happening life. This is a great place to start. If you are in Kansas City, I am definitely certain that you have already heard about this place in the blogs, lists, articles all round the internet when you try to search about things to do in Kansas City. This is a large street of many blocks with Spanish style laid out architecture literally filled with stores, restaurants, boutiques and many more to keep you occupied and make your pockets empty.

Historic and beautiful.  Shopping, restaurants, artwork, and more.  Many would call the Country Club Plaza Kansas City's crown jewel.  Spanish architecture is unique.  There are a few signature events here every year--the Plaza lights and the Plaza art fair being two of them.  The CC Plaza is an amazing place to live and work!

One of the best places to visit in Kansas City. Centrally located Plaza has great stores and restaurants! You can walk around The Plaza for hours. I would highly recommend The Plaza to anyone who lives or is visiting the KCMO area. Parking can be tough to find at times, but worth the search to visit this place.

this place is fantastic!! the whole first floor is filled with the most amazing miniatures. the most detailed dollhouse sized furniture, clothing, tools, plates... you could imagine.  the craftsmanship and details are phenomenal.  truly blown away. then the entire upstairs is a walk through the decades display of toys dating back to the 1700s!! very nicely done and inexpensive.  your heart will smile with nostalgia.

I've been twice now and loved both experiences! Both times I went for school-related reasons but this last time I was able to look around and not be lead by a guide. The guide was amazing but being able to look at what I wanted was very nice. The exhibits are fun and interesting and if you stick around to read and watch everything you really get more from the visit.
I've included some random pictures I took on my phone while we're were there. I needed to take notes on my experience in the Toys From the Attic exhibit specifically for my course, but my favorite exhibits are the dollhouse one and the miniatures section on the first floor.

Best collection of miniatures I have ever seen.  The attention to detail and the variety of scales made it truly amazing.  I also enjoyed the toys through the ages display.  Kids enjoyed the scavenger hunt.  Great place to visit and enjoyed by all who came from ages 6-63.

Fun and playful content for all ages. I saw grandparents with their young grandchildren; college students; and groups of teens.  They have a way to grow though.  Some areas were dark without apparent reason. Some of the art work was not documented as to artist or medium. Two particular works were placed by what appeared to be the building's fans so when the fans 'kicked on' it was scary and unexpected to us viewers and it disrupted the 'mood' of the room. The store was nice and the flow from room to room was smooth. Very interesting.

Truly a place that people of ALL AGES could enjoy! No matter the generation, all would enjoy and have nostalgic memories of childhood. I had a great time visiting that museum. The staff was very helpful if I had any questions. The downstairs of the museum is more "miniatures", while the upstairs is more "toys".

We became members of Community Christian Church for the community.  This church has become a second family to our small family of 3.  I enjoy watching our daughter play with all the other kiddos.   She loves it and always is ready to go on Sundays, and never wants to leave.  It is heartwarming and soul filling to go into a space every Sunday morning where I will hear a message that makes me think and encourages me to be my best self.   I know we will all be accepted just as we are.  At this church, All Means ALL.  Every one is accepted and welcomed.

Words matter. And we struggle to find ones to define ourselves. Here's our current draft: "We are called to grow as an inclusive community of independent, thinking Christians willing to be challenged by the Gospel and by each other. As Disciples of Christ, we strive to live out our identity as 'a movement for wholeness in a fragmented world.' We are committed to our core values of worshiping joyfully, celebrating the arts, and doing justice." I've been a member of The Community Christian Church for twelve years. Yes, the architecture is important, but what happens within our sacred space is more so.

This is such a wonderful and caring congregation.  I've been a member for 25 years and each year it gets better.  There are good programs for children, a focus on social justice, and amazing music and arts to feed the soul in other ways.  I can't imagine attending anywhere else.

I am proud to call Community Christian Church my church home. Messages are relevant and smart. I’m never told what to believe but am always encouraged to search and to be true to myself and to God. Above all, this church is about love. Love is the central message of Jesus and it is what you will find at Community.

Warm congregation? Check
Good worship music? Check
Traditional service? Check
Progressive views of inclusion? Check
Sermons that challenge you? Check

Honestly, this is the first church home where I have actually felt at home. If you really are interested in exploring Christ as he was and is, this is the place for you.
Beautiful store with lots of options. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Larger than most Harley stores I've been to. Definitely worth stopping by.

If not for motor cloths and one boss nobody spoke to me in parts. Was never offered any help. I was in parts over an hour and even went to the desk asking questions! I have tried to give them some of my money but I guess its not good enough.  Why offer to help a customer?  Losing Faith in this place. 4 yrs and counting.

Sheri was the best to work with, she understood my situation and said she could solve this on this coming Monday she is the best. I will referral any person that's inquiring about a Harley Davidson from me to travel to Worth for honest people that care about a customer. Larry Lambert
Excellent Dealership . Friendly staff. Great deal on a bike. Couldn't ask for a better experience !
I brought my bike in to get service service department did a hell of a good job they got me in and out quick

Great place to spend sometime at! There are many shops to go into and everything is accessible by walking. Street parking seems to fill up quickly but there are several parking garages that are free. Definitely a good place for out of town visitors.

The parking there is pretty easily accessible and the walking distance around the Plaza is pretty easy going. You can spend a good part of the day here or just jump in to one of your favorite stores real quick. Security is active as well here and the pathways are pretty clean and you will see the occasional person asking for money on the sides.

There are a few signature events here every year--the Plaza lights and the Plaza art fair being two of them.  The CC Plaza is an amazing place to live and work!

One of the best places to visit in Kansas City. Centrally located Plaza has great stores and restaurants! You can walk around The Plaza for hours. I would highly recommend The Plaza to anyone who lives or is visiting the KCMO area. Parking can be tough to find at times, but worth the search to visit this place.

What amazing service! Very fast service, had my food within five minutes of ordering. Trevor is the best! They said the burnt ends were their best item on the menu, honestly though I've had better burnt ends at a couple different local BBQ places. The beans were delicious and the fries were very good as well. But the bread pudding was the best bread pudding I have ever had in my life, the perfect combination of soft and chewy and melt in your mouth with raisins.
BBQ and blues in a great atmosphere.  Fun time on a Saturday afternoon!  Excellent food.  We bought a pound each of sliced brisket, burnt ends, and a slab of ribs.  DELICIOUS!

Great food, awesome music! And who doesn't love to hear Momma Ray? 
Service could have been a little better. And it does get crowded. The tables are communal and it is tight.
If going on the weekend, plan to go early to get a good seat.

The atmosphere is great. The right level of blues music playing. Very friendly staff. I definitely suggest the hickory smoked meat platter for first time visit because you can get a good sampling of the meats they provide and a couple of sides to boot. Battered fried and beans is good, but so are the skillet fries.

The BBQ was great, as was the live blues band. This place has the appearance of a dive, but that shouldn't scare you away because lots of great BBQ places do. Overall great experience and I will likely be visiting here again.

I don't get down to Kansas City very often but when I do I will go to Gates.
The food was great, the price was right and the service was excellent.  Thank you Tina for helping me with my friends tray. Everyone was so nice and polite.
It might be another year but you will see me again.

Not bad BBQ by any means.  I enjoyed the spice but others in our group did not.  Meat didn't "fall" off the bone but it had good flavor.  Fun, feisty crew who wanted to take a picture with the "lumberjack" in our group who ate several portions of ribs.

One of the newest gate's.  Food is good and the people are friendly.  Not my favorite BBQ place but definitely a good place for tourists.  They have ceiling fans powered by a series of belts which is neat to see.
Only had beef or chicken no pork.  Chicken was dry, sauce was an acquired taste. Baked beans had some type of meat in them and potato salad had carrots.  Think I’ll stick to southern bbq
Meats were good.  Sauces are too spicy.  They tried to only sell us on the $29.50 mea, it was our 1st time there.  Staff was very friendly. Value for money isn't that good.  I prefer Arthur Bryant's.

Yo this place is legit!! Coworker told me about it and I'm already recommending it to other folks. There's not a lot of parking and it looks sketch but that's more of a reason to try it because those type of places are ALWAYS the best. I actually felt comfortable being there because it's not some fancy place but rather like a family owned and ran establishment. I got the beef burnt ends with fries and with how great it tasted makes me want to try everything else on the menu. It's not even that large of a menu but who needs one when you already know why costumers are there.

The burnt ends were absolutely incredible! I was looking for a place that would give me a real taste of Kansas City (instead of just what the tourists see) and this was definitely it! The restaurant is small and casual and feels like it has some history to it. The menu is small, but the food is so great that there’s no need too come up with a bunch of variations of it.

This place is legit. Watching them take racks of meat out of their in house smoker was pretty much a religious experience.
My husband and I drove from MN for some good burnt ends, and that's what we got and then some!

There is no frills about this place, just down home amazing BBQ, great staff and a loyal following. We ate until we could eat no more, but I'm hungry again just thinking about it.

You must go.

Don't judge this establishment by it's cover. The food is amazing. Looking for the low, slow and smoked taste? You found it. I've loved everything I've eaten here. Bring a big appetite an enjoy the food coma. Brisket is phenomenal and so is their sauce.

I absolutely love this barbecue!!! No other BBQ joint in Kansas city has better turkey then this place!!! I only gave it four stars because the ribs were not done in my mixed plate. But the size of the meal is great for the price. I love the hand-cut fries and the baked beans!!!

I've lived in the deep south of coastal  Georgia for 27 years. Low Country Boil is our thing! Craw fish , shrimp, blue crab, sausage,  potatoes,  and corn! Great job Crazy Crab! Today was my first but will not be my last. I recommend you eat it a the restaurant. Taking it home because of how it has to be packaged will have the seafood slightly overcooked. However it was fantastic! Friendly staff good food great atmosphere.

I went there today on March 2 which is my Birthday and I had an Awesome experience! They sang 2 versions of Happy Birthday and really just made my day. I ordered the 1/2 pound Snow 🦀 crab with 2 Lobster tails and it was absolutely 😋 delicious. The staff are Amazing and friendly also my order was done fast.  They gave me everything that I needed to really enjoy my Birthday lunch. I will be back. Keep up the great work! God bless!
Was some of the best shrimp I've eaten in a long time. Our waitress made the whole experience very enjoyable, she is top of the line. Thank You Angelica for the great experience.

The food here was exceptional, and very reasonably priced. The experience of lunch here was fantastic. Our service was provided by Alisha, and it was phenomenal. I am definitely going back. I found a great lunch place!

Crazy Crab is let's you order in a 1,2,3 step way off of the menu. The staff was very helpful with my first visit and let me tag the wall with graffiti!  The menu does have some fried seafood options and chicken fingers for kids or adults who may not like the low country boil bag option.  They also will supply you with some gloves, apron, and wet wipes so you don't have to worry about getting too messy.  I would recommend this place for a Kansas City seafood spot however I didn't think the extra hot cajon came close to spicy.
Great 3rd world atmosphere with high ceilings lined with books and mini altars throughout the space.
I was a fan of the old location, and the new one has the same feel in a larger space. Great job!

The food it is just okay. It taste about as good as if an uncle or brother made it, but that seems to be the vibe that he's going for. It's basically a guy who wanted a place where people could socialize, and "feel at home," but also make money from it. Pretty good model. 

He said that he's been the owner for 20+ years, but it has been around for 90ish years, so that was cool. I would say that while I get that he does want to make people feel like they are just hanging out with friends, he should still treat it as a business. There are no prices anywhere, or even menus. 

There is a Mon-Sun menu up top, but this is only nostalgic, and apparently not relevant. The website Is also obsolete, and says the same thing. That was disappointing because we went for the African Chicken only to discover they didn't have that, or even chicken for that matter. The menu is basically what he feels like making that day until he runs out, so you have to walk up and ask and he'll list off a few things that he can cook. 

There weren't many tasty options for those who don't eat red meat (grits or a black bean burrito was it). When we sat down he told us to "grab a drink and feel at home." Which made it sound like it was complimentary. The same went for asking if we got enough, or he would bring out more. Certainly wouldn't be worth $28 for seconds, but I get it, the bills need to be paid for such a trendy place. I understand the model, but again. put prices somewhere so people will know that they are being charged $14 for the meal (regardless which you choose), and $2-3ish for the drinks. The quality would be worth $8-10 max, or cheaper. 

At least update the website. He's also the only person cooking, so expect to wait or eat reheated leftovers if it's busy. There is limited seating, so if you aren't comfortable asking to sit with strangers, then you will be standing or taking out. He is a super chill guy, and there is also an older live band. He's very trusting of the honor code as well, and has a lot of valuables throughout the shop that he's collected over the years. Very cool stuff, and it's expected that the people who come here will respect that. 

Overall, you're going for the environment or just somewhere to hang or listen to music, but if you are looking for "quality" food, then you should probably go elsewhere. While it isn't bad, it also isn't spectacular or earthshattering.
Very unique restaurant. The employees are very nice and the food is delicious. The prices are extremely reasonable. You won't be disappointed.
Food is ok but Mr. David Ford, the owner, does not pay employees so not much point in paying for food here

I can't write a review because I am dead and in meat heaven. In all seriousness, get here. It's incredible. We had the rib eye and top sirloin. Both were incredible. Get the sweet potato gratin. Fantastic cocktails and the best cow in cowtown. Can't go wrong.

Beautiful space and delicious food. The remodel has really changed the look of the space but has kept that old school feel. We sat at the chef's table and was an interesting view. Usually you can see the whole kitchen but its actually a room. You can hear everything which i loved but can't see everything. That's was OK though since I was there to eat. I had the crab cakes, Lobster Bisque, and the risotto. Each and everything was delicious. My boyfriend got a steak and potato...could have been cooked a little more for his taste but i liked it as it came. We all got dessert and they didn't disappoint. If you haven't been since they have remodeled I would suggest you get on it! Wonderful!

Steaks (ribeye and flat iron) were excellent. The side of beet risotto was some of the best I ever had. Atmosphere was tremendous. Service exceptional. If you’re looking for top notch steak with atmosphere, this is it.

I reserved a table at the Golden Ox for a birthday dinner, as I enjoyed going there for special occasions in the late '90s / early '00s before it closed. It turned out to be an excellent decision.

They did a fantastic job with the renovations, bringing it up to date while still retaining its old-school charm. Quinn, our server, was fantastic from start to finish, and the food (I started with oysters and had the trout for my entrée) was outstanding. I highly recommend the Golden Ox and plan on many return visits in the future.

I love how the steaks are cooked here. Been to many steak houses over the years and Golden Ox is the best cooked steak I have had in years. Learning the extensive history of KC stockyards was a bonus.

Best dine-in place with the most amazing food in Kanpur is Little chef!! You'll have good crowd, nice ambiance and good quality food :) 
Brownie with vanilla ice-cream is the USP of that place. I would highly recommend everyone to visit there at least once.

Food and ambience is good, it has become uttered a bit, parking remains a issue. During one cannot park due to.heavy influx of people in nearby district court, a dozen key government offices
 Evening/night are slightly better but chief's parking remains full for it has a hotel and slot is not big enough for parking more six vehicles at a time. Valet facility can add a relief.

One of very old and well known restaurants of Kanpur-Little Chef sits centrally in Civil Lines, the heart of the Kanpur. The ambience is pleasing. Staff is courteous. Food can be graded a little above average. Tomato soup was very tangy and had many artificial flavours being added to it. Starters and mocktails were fine. Main course was also good but nothing worth remembering. Baked spinach and corn was liked by all of us. Service was unduly long. Overall a three star experience
Always been the best. Taste of dishes is the same since last 25 yrs. Do try their burger, best in Kanpur.
Ambience and Food Both are good.  A little bit over prized.

Exceptional service, small intimate atmosphere. Mike the owner greeted and seated us, even checked on us. Our waitress was so upbeat and helpful. Yes there a wait, we enjoyed a cocktail at the bar with conversation from the bartender,  BUT the food was wonderful and more than enough to take home a whole other meal. We will defiantly be dining again and again.

What can I say besides "Delicious!"? The fried chicken is juicy with a crispy skin. Stroud's is definitely my favorite place for it. The gravy has to be made from the drippings; so good! The homemade noodles in the soup are perfectly dense but not too firm. Best fried livers too. Great service and they always seem to send us home with enough for a couple more meals. Great business, run perfectly for a long time. 2 enthusiastic thumbs up!

If you go a little early, you'll save yourself a wait. The chicken lives up to the hype, the gravy is fantastic and doesn't taste like a mix, and the gizzards are great. The cinnamon buns at the end are gooey and delicious. The service is super friendly and attentive, and the owner checks on everyone personally. It's not a cheap place to eat, but portions are huge and the value is good.

Hands down, best fried chicken you will find anywhere. Everything is served family style and the portions are huge. The gravy is fantastic. The cinnamon rolls are worth the trip, even if you aren't huge into fried chicken.. 
Plus, the building is old, quirky, and and welcoming. The owner sat us at our table and the service was excellent.

I'm actually on the fence about this place. It's a good eat with lots of food but at a pretty steep price. It's a cool setting for a restaurant as it sits in an old house with lots if views. A really cool place to go once or twice. All in all just not my thing.
